messages.message: Good morning. Just logging my fasting blood sugar. It was 105 mg/dL today.
Good morning, John. Thank you for logging your sugar level. A fasting level of 105 mg/dL is a great start to the day. How are you feeling?
Feeling pretty good. I had a good walk yesterday evening, about 40 minutes. I think that helped.
That's excellent, John! Consistent physical activity like that can certainly have a positive impact on your morning blood sugar levels. What are your plans for breakfast today?
I'm having my usual: two scrambled eggs with spinach and a slice of whole-wheat toast.
That sounds like a healthy and balanced choice. Keep up the great work, John!
Hi, just took my pre-lunch reading. It's 120 mg/dL. I'm about to eat.
Hi John, thanks for the update. 120 mg/dL is a good pre-meal number. What are you having for lunch?
I've packed a chicken salad with lots of greens, and a small pear. I'm also taking my 5 units of rapid-acting insulin as prescribed.

That sounds like a perfect meal, John. It's great that you're so on top of your insulin doses with your meals. Remember to check your levels again in about 2 hours to see how you responded. Enjoy your lunch!
Evening. My post-dinner glucose is 145 mg/dL. I had grilled salmon with roasted vegetables.
Good evening, John. Thanks for logging your evening reading. 145 mg/dL after a meal is a solid number. The grilled salmon and roasted vegetables sound like a great choice.
Thanks. I also went to the gym today at lunchtime, did about 30 minutes on the elliptical. It's been a good day for my numbers.

It certainly sounds like it! Your efforts with both your diet and exercise are clearly reflected in your glucose levels. It's great to see you're finding a routine that works for you. Have a relaxing evening.
